quest.name: Sinking Doesmaga
journal: Acting Guildmaster Thubyrgeim has instructions for you from Foreseer K'lyhia.

Thubyrgeim explains that K'lyhia has already begun her grand strategy that will culminate in Doesmaga's downfall. Your first task in this daring scheme is to deliver a set of instructions to a fisherman known as Rhylzirn, who can be found in Costa del Sol, in eastern La Noscea.
After delivering the list to Rhylzirn, you are rewarded with a fresh herring. Your next task, according to the gruff fisherman, is to take the fish you received to the cook, Opylona.

Opylona, happy to receive the freshly caught herring, insists you take one of her homemade eel pies. The cook then relays instructions from “your arcanist colleague”: you are to deliver the pastry to Master Gegeruju, rather than succumb to the demands of your stomach.

In return for the eel pie, Master Gegeruju rewards you with a heavy purse of gil. Before you can begin counting out your new fortune, however, you receive K'lyhia's next set of instructions from P'ebaloh. It seems you must deliver the bulging sack of coins to Ealdgyth the dancer.

For what seems a somewhat exorbitant price, you give the hefty purse to Ealdgyth in exchange for her well-worn pareo and a mysterious leather satchel. As instructed, take the pareo to Drogo, the warehouse foreman.

Drogo, still questioning his good fortune at receiving Ealdgyth's pareo, gives you a bottle of vintage wine. Take the bottle, and pour a cup for the Morningstar crew members who are drinking at the Flying Shark.
Impressed with the vintage of the wine, Hirskskrat invites you aboard the Morningstar to talk business with Captain Doesmaga. Speak with Hirskskrat at the jetty when you are ready to depart.

K'lyhia's clever tactics coupled with your flawless execution have led to the resounding defeat of the pirate Doesmaga. With her past firmly behind her, the foreseer is able to clearly see the reality she desired all along. Return to the Arcanists' Guild and inform Thubyrgeim of K'lyhia's decision to seek out the guildmaster.
Hand over the odd leather satchel to Thubyrgeim.

After hearing of your exploits and learning of K'lyhia's decision, Thubyrgeim concludes that the pairing of the arcanima-obsessed guildmaster and foreseer will lead to great advances in the art of the arcanist. Citing your involvement as the catalyst for these developments, the acting guildmaster rewards you with a new technique and encourages you to continue improving in your chosen discipline.
objectives: Deliver the list to Rhylzirn in Costa del Sol.
Deliver the fresh herring to Opylona.
Deliver the homemade eel pie to Gegeruju.
Deliver the heavy purse to Ealdgyth.
Deliver the well-worn pareo to Drogo.
Deliver the bottle of vintage wine to the sailors.
Report to Thubyrgeim at the Arcanists' Guild.
Hand over the leather satchel to Thubyrgeim.
Sweep aside the crew of the Morningstar and defeat Doesmaga!

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: I've been expecting you, Forename. As ever, K'lyhia's predictions prove accurate almost down to the moment. And her mind is especially sharp with such a dangerous confrontation in the offing.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: The Yellowjackets have contacted us with word of Doesmaga: it appears his merchant vessel is presently anchored off the coast of Bloodshore.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Once the pirate's business there is concluded, rumor has it that he intends to embark on an extended voyage to the East. It will be some time before he returns once more to Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: If we pass up this opportunity, K'lyhia will lose her chance to settle the score with Doesmaga─and we risk the foreseer stumbling once more into blackest melancholy.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Simply getting close enough to Doesmaga will prove difficult. K'lyhia has, however, already formulated a solution, and has set her grand strategy into motion.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Your first task in this undertaking is to travel to Costa del Sol and deliver this set of directions to a fisherman by the name of Rhylzirn. More instructions will be forthcoming.

dialogue.name: RHYLZIRN
dialogue.text: What is it ye want, lasslad? As ye can see, I've me 'ands full with me fishin'...

dialogue.name: RHYLZIRN
dialogue.text: Ah, thanks fer that. I been told to expect ye. 'Ere, yer to take one o' me 'errings and deliver it to the cook, Opylona.

dialogue.name: OPYLONA
dialogue.text: Yes, and how might I help you? Master Gegeruju is expecting his supperbreakfastmidday meal any moment now...

dialogue.name: OPYLONA
dialogue.text: A fresh herring? Why, the master does enjoy a bite of broiled fish of an eveninga morningan afternoon. This might even earn me a few extra coins for this week's wages!

dialogue.name: OPYLONA
dialogue.text: Well, you have earned yourself one of my homemade eel pies! I should tell you, though, your arcanist colleague was quite insistent that you take the pie to Master Gegeruju, rather than scoff it down yourself.

dialogue.name: GEGERUJU
dialogue.text: And what brings you to my─and I use the term facetiously─humble abode, dear madamsir? Mmm, such a heavenly aroma. Are you, perchance, carrying an eel pie about your person?

dialogue.name: GEGERUJU
dialogue.text: How commendable that you should research the delicacies that tickle my fancy before daring to intrude upon my most ponderous of ponderings. Speaking of ponderous─well, I was speaking of it, at least─I have a hefty purse of gil to persuade you to relinquish your claim on that pastry...

dialogue.name: PEBALOH
dialogue.text: One moment, if you will. I have been instructed by a Mealvaan's Gate assessor to hand over this message to whoever delivers an eel pie to Master Gegeruju.

dialogue.name: TALK
dialogue.text:
(-Message-)Take the purse you received from Master Gegeruju, and hand it to the dancer Ealdgyth as she prepares to return home.

K'lyhia

dialogue.name: EALDGYTH
dialogue.text: Yes? If you're looking for a dancer, then I would first see your coin. I've three children to feed, and no time to waste on idle chat.

dialogue.name: EALDGYTH
dialogue.text: Oh my, that is quite a purse! My precious darlings will eat like kings this week!

dialogue.name: EALDGYTH
dialogue.text: And such a simple job, as well. I was told to expect you, you see. In return for the coin, I am to give you these.

dialogue.name: EALDGYTH
dialogue.text: The leather satchel is from your Miqo'te friend, and the pareo is from me. That last item you are to deliver to Drogo, the warehouse foreman.

dialogue.name: DROGO
dialogue.text: I ain't got time fer the likes o' you: if I don't get me work squared away soon, the master'll 'ave me 'ead on a pike. Hm? Ye got summat fer me, ye say?

dialogue.name: DROGO
dialogue.text: 'Ey, now, ain't this Ealdgyth's pareo!?

dialogue.name: DROGO
dialogue.text: That Miqo'te lass said someone'd be bringin' me a gift what I couldn't refuse, an' stick me with a pitchfork if she weren't tellin' the gods' own truth! 'Ere, yer s'posed to 'ave this bottle o' wine.

dialogue.name: DROGO
dialogue.text: Take it to the Flyin' Shark an' pour a cup fer the sailors what're drinkin' there. That's what she told me to tell ye, anyroad. I'd watch me back if I was you, though, lassson─them sailors're the meanest bunch o' cutthroats I ever did see.

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Ye want me to taste yer wine, eh? Well, now, I ain't one to pass up free grog.

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Llymlaen's teats! Now that's a bloody fine drop! If we ship this stuff to the East, we'll be sellin' bottles by the crate!

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Yer comin' with us back to the Morningstar. The captain'll want to 'ave a word with ye.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Agree to board the Morningstar?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Eh? Are ye tryin' to turn down me business proposition!? I reckon ye might want to think again.

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: There's a good lasslad. An' as fer ye, Miss Dancer, ye stick close to ol' Hirskskrat─it gets damn cold on them long sea voyages, heh heh heh.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: (Shhh. We'll talk later.)

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: (Hush now, Forename. Make ready. And I'll need that satchel you received from Ealdgyth in a short while...)

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Ye ready, then? We'll be off as soon as the boat's loaded.

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Ah, fine grog an' a fine woman. The captain'll be pleased with this haul.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Pray do not stare so. This was the most expedient method of gaining access to the ship.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: I will take that satchel from you now. You may have it back after I take the items I need.

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: 'Ey, what mischief are you two about!?

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: I was merely borrowing some clothes. You wouldn't wish me to catch a chill from this brisk ocean air, would you?

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Ye'll be dancin' yerself warm once we get ye on the ship, lass.

dialogue.name: HIRSKSKRAT
dialogue.text: Ye better slip off that ratty robe afore ye meet the captain.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Of course, of course!

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: I'll be happy to show him the performance that awaits!

dialogue.name: DOSWMAGA
dialogue.text: The bitch Admiral's lapdog! Come back fer that lesson, 'ave ye?

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: It is I who shall be teaching this day! My lecture will focus on the manipulation of reality through applied strategy!

dialogue.name: DOSWMAGA
dialogue.text: Enough o' this damn yappin'! By the time I'm done with ye, ye'll remember who yer real master is!

dialogue.name: DOSWMAGA
dialogue.text: Ye rabid little cur!

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Our numbers matter not; it is strategy that will win this battle!

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Prepare yourself, Doesmaga! With your defeat will I cast off the shackles you closed on my soul!

dialogue.name: DOSWMAGA
dialogue.text: Ye think so, eh? Think yer fancy magicks're a match fer my blade!? Ye've got another thing comin'!

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Doesmaga now faces defeat. He will flee to the starboard rail.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Obvious. Next comes his attempt to escape into the sea.

dialogue.name: DOSWMAGA
dialogue.text: Ye think yer pullin' me strings, do ye!? Think I'll dance to yer tune?

dialogue.name: TALK
dialogue.text: Well, I ain't fallin' fer yer bloody tricks!

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: It is at this moment he notices the Yellowjackets I had you summon in my explicit instructions to Rhylzirn.

dialogue.name: RHYLZIRN
dialogue.text: You were a fool to return, Doesmaga! I hear you're fond of shackles, so we brought a set especially for you!

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Thus concludes today's lecture.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. This strategy would not have succeeded without your flawless execution.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: ...Which suggests that my tactics yet require more work. One must allow for some small deviation in performance.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: I believe, however, that I now understand where my calculations went awry: it is not enough to wish to shape reality; one must also have a complete understanding of the reality one wishes to obtain.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: It is time I sought out our guildmaster!

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: Pray convey to Mistress Thubyrgeim my fondest wishes, and my appreciation for all that she has done for me.

dialogue.name: KLYHIA
dialogue.text: The true test of my strategies now begins!

dialogue.name: YELLOW
dialogue.text: You have our gratitude. Without your bravery and skill, the Yellowjackets would still be floundering in Doesmaga's wake. Pray also send our regards to Acting Guildmaster Thubyrgeim.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. There is much I would ask you, but first, may I have the satchel you received during your assignment?

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: May I have the leather satchel you received during your assignment?

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: The original owner needs her costume back, you see. I'll make sure everything is returned safe and sound.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Now, let us speak of K'lyhia. I am glad to know that she has finally freed herself to pursue her heart's desire. And you are to thank for awakening the foreseer to her self-imposed fetters.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: The brilliance of K'lyhia's strategies served to blind her to her own feelings, and it pained me to see her suffer so.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Your example may even encourage K'lyhia to improve her combat abilities, although such will surely come in time─after all, she intends to study under the guildmaster's direct instruction. Imagine those two obsessive arcanists, and the complexity of the tactics they will develop...

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: It may very well be that your actions in bringing them together will prove the catalyst that sparks a new era of invention in the art of arcanima.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: You, too, should look to the improvement of your discipline if you are to keep pace with all that is certain to follow. To that end, I offer you a new technique, one I pray allows you to more readily drive back your foes on the battlefield.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Forename!
This geometry will turn the tide of the battle!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Fight, ye worthless sea slugs!
I oughta keelhaul the lot o' ye!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Your brutalized crew is not up to the task, Doesmaga!
I calculate our odds of victory at 99%!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Hmph, so ye can handle a few deck scrags.
Me axe'll carve yer petty plans into bloody ruin!
